Enum.name: RETAIN
Enum.description: Retain associated registers when in EM2/3

Enum.name: NORETAIN
Enum.description: Do not retain associcated registers when in EM2/3

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: No Retention: Pads enter reset state when entering EM4

Enum.name: EM4EXIT
Enum.description: Retention through EM4: Pads enter reset state when exiting EM4

Enum.name: SWUNLATCH
Enum.description: Retention through EM4 and Wakeup: software writes UNLATCH register to remove retention

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: Remove fixed capacitance on XI and XO nodes

Enum.name: XI
Enum.description: Adds fixed capacitance on XI node

Enum.name: XO
Enum.description: Adds fixed capacitance on XO node

Enum.name: BOTH
Enum.description: Adds fixed capacitance on both XI and XO nodes

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: Do not apply core degeneration resistence

Enum.name: EXTCLK
Enum.description: external sinusoidal clock can be supplied on XI pin.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Squaring buffer schmitt trigger is disabled

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Squaring buffer schmitt trigger is enabled

Register.name: CFG
Register.description: Do not write to this register unless the oscillator is forced off. The oscillator is forced off if DISONDEMAND is set and FORCEEN is cleared.

Enum.name: XTAL
Enum.description: A 32768Hz crystal should be connected to the LF crystal pads. Voltage must not exceed VDDIO.

Enum.name: BUFEXTCLK
Enum.description: An external sine source with minimum amplitude 100mv (zero-to-peak) and maximum amplitude 500mV (zero-to-peak) should be connected in series with LFXTAL_I pin. Minimum voltage should be larger than ground and maximum voltage smaller than VDDIO. The sine source does not need to be ac coupled externally as it is ac couples inside LFXO. LFXTAL_O is free to be used as a general purpose GPIO.

Enum.name: DIGEXTCLK
Enum.description: An external 32KHz CMOS clock should be provided on LFXTAL_I. LFXTAL_O is free to be used as a general purpose GPIO.

Enum.name: UNLOCKED
Enum.description: LFXO lockable registers are not locked

Register.name: CAL
Register.description: Do not write to this register unless CALBSY in SYNCBUSY register is low.

Enum.name: UNLOCKED
Enum.description: Access to configuration registers not locked

BitField.name: TCOOR
BitField.description: Temperature Check Out Of Range Flag

BitField.name: TCOOR
BitField.description: Temperature Check Out Of Range Enable

Register.name: LOCK
Register.description: Configuration lock register. Locks and unlocks access to configuration registers.

Enum.name: WS0
Enum.description: Zero wait-states inserted in fetch or read transfers

Enum.name: WS1
Enum.description: One wait-state inserted for each fetch or read transfer

Enum.name: WS2
Enum.description: Two wait-states inserted for eatch fetch or read transfer

Enum.name: WS3
Enum.description: Three wait-states inserted for eatch fetch or read transfer

BitField.name: ADDRB
BitField.description: Page Erase or Write Address Buffer

BitField.name: INVADDR
BitField.description: Invalid Write Address or Erase Page

BitField.name: PWRUPCKBDFAILCOUNT
BitField.description: Flash power up checkerboard pattern chec

BitField.name: ERASE
BitField.description: Host Erase Done Interrupt Read Flag

BitField.name: WRITE
BitField.description: Host Write Done Interrupt Read Flag

BitField.name: PWRUPF
BitField.description: Flash Power Up Sequence Complete Flag

BitField.name: PWROFF
BitField.description: Flash Power Off Sequence Complete Flag

BitField.name: WDATAOV
BitField.description: write data buffer overflow irq enable

BitField.name: PWRUPF
BitField.description: Flash Power Up Seq done irq enable

BitField.name: PWROFF
BitField.description: Flash Power Off Seq done irq enable

Enum.name: LOCK
Enum.description: Key to lock the register lock

Enum.name: UNLOCK
Enum.description: Key to unlock the register lock.

BitField.name: PWROFFONEM1ENTRY
BitField.description: Power down Flash macro when enter EM1

BitField.name: PWROFFENTRYAGAIN
BitField.description: POWER down flash again in EM1/EM1p

Register.name: IPVERSION
Register.description: The read only IPVERSION field gives the version for this module. There may be minor software changes required for modules with different values of IPVERSION.

Enum.name: ADVANCED
Enum.description: Advanced buffering mode, where the cache uses the fetch pattern to predict highly accessed data and store it in low-energy memory

Enum.name: MINACTIVITY
Enum.description: Minimum activity mode, which allows the cache to minimize activity in logic that it predicts has a low probability being used. This mode can introduce wait-states into the instruction fetch stream when the cache exits one of its low-activity states. The number of wait-states introduced is small, but users running with 0-wait-state memory and wishing to reduce the variability that the cache might introduce with additional wait-states may wish to lower the cache low-power level. Note, this mode includes the advanced buffering mode functionality.

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: Increment source address by one unit data size after each read

Enum.description: Increment source address by two unit data sizes after each read

Enum.name: FOUR
Enum.description: Increment source address by four unit data sizes after each read

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: Do not increment the source address. In this mode reads are made from a fixed source address, for example reading FIFO.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Timer operation is unaffected by other timers.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Timer may be started, stopped and re-loaded from other timer instances.

Enum.name: HALT
Enum.description: Timer is halted in debug mode

Enum.name: RUN
Enum.description: Timer is running in debug mode

Enum.name: TIMEROUF
Enum.description: Timer is clocked by underflow(down-count) or overflow(up-count) in the lower numbered neighbor Timer

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: Timer can start/stop/reload other timers with SYNC bit set

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: Timer cannot start/stop/reload other timers with SYNC bit set

Enum.name: PULSE
Enum.description: Each CC event will generate a one EM01GRPACLK cycle high pulse

Enum.name: LEVEL
Enum.description: The PRS channel will follow CC out

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: No edge detection, signal is left as it is

Enum.name: EVERYEDGE
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on every capture

Enum.name: EVERYSECONDEDGE
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on every second capture

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The USART operates in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The USART operates in synchronous mode

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The receiver is connected to and receives data from U(S)n_RX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The receiver is connected to and receives data from U(S)n_TX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Collision check is enabled. The receiver must be enabled for the check to be performed

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The 9th bit of incoming frames has no special function

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: An incoming frame with the 9th bit equal to MPAB will be loaded into the receive buffer regardless of RXBLOCK and will result in the MPAB interrupt flag being set

Enum.name: X16
Enum.description: Regular UART mode with 16X oversampling in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: X8
Enum.description: Double speed with 8X oversampling in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: X4
Enum.description: Quadruple speed with 4X oversampling in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: IDLELOW
Enum.description: The bus clock used in synchronous mode has a low base value

Enum.name: IDLEHIGH
Enum.description: The bus clock used in synchronous mode has a high base value

Enum.name: SAMPLELEADING
Enum.description: Data is sampled on the leading edge and set-up on the trailing edge of the bus clock in synchronous mode

Enum.name: SAMPLETRAILING
Enum.description: Data is set-up on the leading edge and sampled on the trailing edge of the bus clock in synchronous mode

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Data is sent with the least significant bit first

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Data is sent with the most significant bit first

BitField.name: CSMA
BitField.description: Action On Slave-Select In Master Mode

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: TXBL and the TXBL interrupt flag are set when the transmit buffer becomes empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes nonempty.

Enum.name: HALFFULL
Enum.description: TXBL and TXBLIF are set when the transmit buffer goes from full to half-full or empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes full.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Input is passed directly to the receiver

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Input is inverted before it is passed to the receiver

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Output from the transmitter is passed unchanged to U(S)n_TX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Output from the transmitter is inverted before it is passed to U(S)n_TX

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The output on U(S)n_TX when the transmitter is idle is defined by TXINV

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: U(S)n_TX is tristated whenever the transmitter is idle

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors have no effect on DMA requests from the USART

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: DMA requests from the USART are blocked while the PERR or FERR interrupt flags are set

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors have no effect on receiver

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors disable the receiver

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Received framing and parity errors have no effect on transmitter

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Received framing and parity errors disable the transmitter

BitField.name: AUTOTX
BitField.description: Always Transmit When RX Not Full

Enum.name: EVEN
Enum.description: Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

Enum.name: ODD
Enum.description: Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

Enum.name: HALF
Enum.description: The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: One stop bit is generated and verified

Enum.name: ONEANDAHALF
Enum.description: The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.description: Addresses matching the programmed slave address or the general call address (if enabled) require a response from software. Other addresses are automatically responded to with a NACK.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Software must give one ACK command for each ACK transmitted on the I2C bus.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Addresses that are not automatically NACK'ed, and all data is automatically acknowledged.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: A stop must be sent manually when no more data is to be transmitted.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The master automatically sends a STOP when no more data is available for transmission.

Enum.name: DISABLE

Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.name: FAST

Enum.name: WUDVL
Enum.description: When using suspend mode, conversions performed in EM2 or EM3 should not wake up the DMA until the FIFO's DVL setting is reached. This saves more power for large OSR settings or infrequent sampling.

Enum.name: WUCONVERT
Enum.description: When using suspend mode, conversions performed in EM2 or EM3 will wake up the DMA and keep it awake until the conversions are done, regardless of the DVL setting. This mode burns more power, but it is useful when the conversion rate is faster than the time for the DMA to cycle through wake up and going back to sleep as it converts more than 4 scan table entries. Without using the wake up on conversion mode, the FIFO may overflow while the DMA is going in and out of sleep.

Enum.name: PRSWUDIS
Enum.description: Normal mode which does not disable the ADC_CLK.

Enum.name: PRSWUEN
Enum.description: ADCCLKWUEN will gate off ADC_CLK until the trigger is detected provided the internal timer is not selected as the trigger. Once the trigger is detected the ADC_CLK will be started, the band gap will be started, the ADC will be warmed up, and the SCAN Table and the Single entry will be converted. Once the conversions are done, the ADC_CLK will be gated off.

Enum.name: PRSWUDIS
Enum.description: Normal mode which does not disable the ADC_CLK.

Enum.name: PRSWUEN
Enum.description: ADCCLKWUEN will gate off ADC_CLK until the trigger is detected provided the internal timer is not selected as the trigger. Once the trigger is detected the ADC_CLK will be started, the band gap will be started, the ADC will be warmed up, and the SCAN Table and the Single entry will be converted. Once the conversions are done, the ADC_CLK will be gated off.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Continue operation as normal during debug mode

Enum.name: HALT
Enum.description: Complete the current conversion and then halt during debug mode

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Shut down the IADC after conversions have completed.

Enum.name: KEEPINSTANDBY
Enum.description: Switch to standby mode after conversions have completed. The next warmup time will require 1us.

Enum.name: KEEPWARM
Enum.description: Keep IADC fully powered after conversions have completed.

Enum.name: DIV1
Enum.description: Use CMU_CLK_ADC directly. The source clock must be 40 MHz or less.

Enum.name: DIV2
Enum.description: Divide CMU_CLK_ADC by 2 before using it. The resulting CLK_SRC_ADC must be 40 MHz or less.

Enum.name: DIV3
Enum.description: Divide CMU_CLK_ADC by 3 before using it. The resulting CLK_SRC_ADC must be 40 MHz or less.

Enum.name: DIV4
Enum.description: Divide CMU_CLK_ADC by 4 before using it. The resulting CLK_SRC_ADC must be 40 MHz or less.

BitField.description: ADC Less Than or Equal to Threshold

BitField.name: ADGT
BitField.description: ADC Greater Than or Equal to Threshold

BitField.description: Single FIFO Data Valid Level Enable

BitField.name: SCANFIFODVL

Enum.name: IMMEDIATE
Enum.description: Immediate triggering. The scan queue will be disabled once all conversions in the scan table are complete, unless TRIGGERACTION is set to continuous.

Enum.name: TIMER
Enum.description: Triggers when the local timer count reaches zero.

Enum.name: PRSCLKGRP
Enum.description: Triggers on PRS0 from a timer module that is using the same clock group as the ADC and has been programmed to use the same clock source as the ADC. The prescale may be different between the ADC and the timer module.

Enum.name: PRSPOS
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS0 positive edge. Requires PRS0 to go low for 3 ADC_CLKs before another positive edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization.

Enum.name: PRSNEG
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS0 negative edge. Requires PRS0 to go high for 3 ADC_CLKs before another negative edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization. PRSNEG should only be used when the trigger source is from a module that remains powered during EM23. For modules (ie: TIMER) that power down during EM23, PRSPOS should be used for an asynchronous trigger, and PRSCLKGRP should be used for a synchronous trigger.

Enum.name: ONCE
Enum.description: For TRIGSEL=IMMEDIATE, goes through the scan table once and disables queue. For TRIGSEL = TIMER, PRSCLKGRP, PRSPOS, PRSNEG, goes through the scan table once per trigger.

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Goes through the scan table, converts each entry with a mask bit set, and puts it back into the scan queue to repeat again continuously. The queues are first come first serve. If both queues are triggered, the single queue will get to convert after each scan table completes. The scan queue will get to convert after each single conversion completes.

Enum.name: IMMEDIATE
Enum.description: Immediate triggering. The single queue will be disabled once the conversion is complete, unless TRIGGERACTION is set to continuous.

Enum.name: TIMER
Enum.description: Triggers when the local timer count reaches zero.

Enum.name: PRSCLKGRP
Enum.description: Triggers on PRS1 from a timer module that is using the same clock group as the ADC and has been programmed to use the same clock source as the ADC. The prescale may be different between the ADC and the timer module.

Enum.name: PRSPOS
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS1 positive edge. Requires PRS1 to go low for 3 ADC_CLKs before another positive edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization.

Enum.name: PRSNEG
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS1 negative edge. Requires PRS1 to go high for 3 ADC_CLKs before another negative edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization. PRSNEG should only be used when the trigger source is from a module that remains powered during EM23. For modules (ie: TIMER) that power down during EM23, PRSPOS should be used for an asynchronous trigger, and PRSCLKGRP should be used for a synchronous trigger.

Enum.name: ONCE
Enum.description: For TRIGSEL=IMMEDIATE, converts the single queue once and disables queue. For TRIGSEL = TIMER, PRSCLKGRP, PRSPOS, PRSNEG, converts the single queue once per trigger.ask.

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Converts the single queue, then checks for a pending scan queue before converting the single queue again continuously. The queues are first come first serve. If both queues are continuous, the IADC alternates between them.

Enum.name: TAILGATEOFF
Enum.description: The single queue is ready to start warming up and converting once the trigger had been detected.

Enum.name: TAILGATEON
Enum.description: After the single queue's trigger is detected, it must wait until the end of a scan operation before the Single queue can be converted.

Enum.description: High speed mode with a maximum CLK_ADC of 10 MHz.

Enum.description: Collect one output word (no digital averaging).

Enum.name: AVG2
Enum.description: Collect and average 2 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG4
Enum.description: Collect and average 4 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG8
Enum.description: Collect and average 8 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG16
Enum.description: Collect and average 16 digital output words.

Enum.description: Automatic: Single ended measurements are reported as unipolar and differential measurements are reported as bipolar.

Enum.name: FORCEUNIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in unipolar output. Negative differential numbers will saturate to 0.

Enum.name: FORCEBIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in bipolar output. Single ended measurements are half the range, but allow for small negative measurements.

Enum.description: High speed mode with a maximum CLK_ADC of 10 MHz.

Enum.description: Collect and average 8 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG16
Enum.description: Collect and average 16 digital output words.

Enum.name: AUTO
Enum.description: Automatic: Single ended measurements are reported as unipolar and differential measurements are reported as bipolar.

Enum.name: FORCEUNIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in unipolar output. Negative differential numbers will saturate to 0.

Enum.name: FORCEBIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in bipolar output. Single ended measurements are half the range, but allow for small negative measurements.

Enum.name: VALID1
Enum.description: When 1 entry in the single FIFO is valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID2
Enum.description: When 2 entries in the single FIFO are valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID3
Enum.description: When 3 entries in the single FIFO are valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID4
Enum.description: When 4 entries in the single FIFO are valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will not be requested.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will be requested when the single FIFO reaches its Data Valid Level. [DVL must be set to 0 (VALID1).]

Register.name: SINGLEFIFODATA
Register.description: Read the oldest valid data from the single FIFO and pop the FIFO

Enum.name: VALID1
Enum.description: When 1 entry in the scan FIFO is valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID2
Enum.description: When 2 entries in the scan FIFO are valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID3
Enum.description: When 3 entries in the scan FIFO are valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID4
Enum.description: When 4 entries in the scan FIFO are valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will not be requested.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will be requested when the scan FIFO reaches its Data Valid Level. [DVL must be set to 0 (VALID1).]

Register.name: SCANFIFODATA
Register.description: Read the oldest valid data from the scan FIFO and pop the FIFO

Register.name: SCANDATA
Register.description: Most recent data data from scan queue conversion

BitField.name: CORERST
BitField.description: Soft Reset the internal state registers

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: No change to internal state registers

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: All addresses will be responded to with a NACK

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Addresses matching the programmed slave address or the general call address (if enabled) require a response from software. Other addresses are automatically responded to with a NACK.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Software must give one ACK command for each ACK transmitted on the I2C bus.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Addresses that are not automatically NACK'ed, and all data is automatically acknowledged.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: A stop must be sent manually when no more data is to be transmitted.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The master automatically sends a STOP when no more data is available for transmission.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Stop is not automatically sent if a NACK is received from a slave.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The master automatically sends a STOP if a NACK is received from a slave.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: When a device loses arbitration, the ARBIF interrupt flag is set and the bus is released.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: When a device loses arbitration, the ARBIF interrupt flag is set, but communication proceeds.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: General call address will be NACK'ed if it is not included by the slave address and address mask.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: When a general call address is received, a software response is required

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: TXBL status and the TXBL interrupt flag are set when the transmit buffer becomes empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes nonempty.

Enum.name: HALF_FULL
Enum.description: TXBL status and the TXBL interrupt flag are set when the transmit buffer goes from full to half-full or empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes full

Enum.name: STANDARD
Enum.description: Nlow=4 and Nhigh=4, and the Nlow:Nhigh ratio is 4:4

Enum.name: ASYMMETRIC
Enum.description: Nlow=6 and Nhigh=3, and the Nlow:Nhigh ratio is 6:3

Enum.name: FAST
Enum.description: Nlow=11 and Nhigh=6, and the Nlow:Nhigh ratio is 11:6

Enum.name: I2C40PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout.

Enum.name: I2C80PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout.

Enum.name: I2C160PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout.

BitField.name: GIBITO
BitField.description: Go Idle on Bus Idle Timeout

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: A bus idle timeout has no effect on the bus state.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A bus idle timeout tells the I2C module that the bus is idle, allowing new transfers to be initiated.

Enum.name: I2C40PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 40 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 50us timeout.

Enum.name: I2C80PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 80 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 100us timeout.

Enum.name: I2C160PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 160 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 200us timeout.

Enum.name: I2C320PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 320 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 400us timeout.

Enum.name: I2C1024PCC
Enum.description: Timeout after 1024 prescaled clock cycles. In standard mode at 100 kHz, this results in a 1280us timeout.

Enum.name: WAIT
Enum.description: Waiting for idle. Will send a start condition as soon as the bus is idle.

Enum.name: ADDRACK
Enum.description: Address ack/nack transmit or receive phase

Enum.name: DATAACK
Enum.description: Data ack/nack transmit or receive phase

Enum.name: SW
Enum.description: A write to the clear bit will clear the WDOG counter

Enum.name: PRSSRC0
Enum.description: A rising edge on the PRS Source 0 will clear the WDOG counter

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: WDOG timer is frozen in EM2.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: WDOG timer is running in EM2.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: WDOG timer is frozen in EM3.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: WDOG timer is running in EM3.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: EM4 can be entered by software. See EMU for detailed description.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: EM4 cannot be entered by software.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: WDOG timer is frozen in debug mode

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: WDOG timer is running in debug mode

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: A timeout will cause a WDOG reset

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: A timeout will not cause a WDOG reset

BitField.name: PRS0MISSRSTEN
BitField.description: PRS Src0 Missing Event WDOG Reset

BitField.name: PRS1MISSRSTEN
BitField.description: PRS Src1 Missing Event WDOG Reset

Enum.name: SEL1
Enum.description: Warning timeout is 25% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL2
Enum.description: Warning timeout is 50% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL3
Enum.description: Warning timeout is 75% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL1
Enum.description: Window timeout is 12.5% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL2
Enum.description: Window timeout is 25% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL3
Enum.description: Window timeout is 37.5% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL4
Enum.description: Window timeout is 50% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL5
Enum.description: Window timeout is 62.5% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL6
Enum.description: Window timeout is 75.5% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: SEL7
Enum.description: Window timeout is 87.5% of the Timeout.

Enum.name: UNLOCKED
Enum.description: All WDOG lockable registers are unlocked.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: All WDOG lockable registers are locked.

BitField.name: PEM0
BitField.description: PRS Src0 Event Missing Interrupt Flag

BitField.name: PEM1
BitField.description: PRS Src1 Event Missing Interrupt Flag

BitField.name: PEM0
BitField.description: PRS Src0 Event Missing Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: PEM1
BitField.description: PRS Src1 Event Missing Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: VOLTAGECTRLLO
BitField.description: Charge Pump Voltage Control Low Power

BitField.name: VOLTAGECTRLHI
BitField.description: Charge Pump Voltage Control High Power

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The receiver is connected to and receives data from UARTn_RX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The receiver is connected to and receives data from UARTn_TX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Collision check is enabled. The receiver must be enabled for the check to be performed

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The 9th bit of incoming frames has no special function

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: An incoming frame with the 9th bit equal to MPAB will be loaded into the RX FIFO regardless of RXBLOCK and will result in the MPAB interrupt flag being set

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Data is sent with the least significant bit first

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Data is sent with the most significant bit first

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Input is passed directly to the receiver

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Input is inverted before it is passed to the receiver

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Output from the transmitter is passed unchanged to UARTn_TX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Output from the transmitter is inverted before it is passed to UARTn_TX

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The output on UARTn_TX when the transmitter is idle is defined by TXINV

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: UARTn_TX is tristated whenever the transmitter is idle

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors have no effect on DMA requests from the UART

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: DMA requests from the UART are blocked while the PERR or FERR interrupt flags are set

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors have no effect on receiver

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors disable the receiver

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Received framing and parity errors have no effect on transmitter

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Received framing and parity errors disable the transmitter

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Continue normal UART operation even if core is halted

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: If core is halted, receive one frame and then halt reception by deactivating RTS. Next frame reception happens when the core is unhalted during single stepping.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The CTS pin is active low

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The CTS pin is active high

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Stop transmitting when CTS is inactive

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The RTS pin is active low

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The RTS pin is active high

Enum.name: ONEFRAME
Enum.description: TXFL status flag and IF are set when the TX FIFO has space for at least one more frame.

Enum.name: TWOFRAMES
Enum.description: TXFL status flag and IF are set when the TX FIFO has space for at least two more frames.

Enum.name: THREEFRAMES
Enum.description: TXFL status flag and IF are set when the TX FIFO has space for at least three more frames.

Enum.name: FOURFRAMES
Enum.description: TXFL status flag and IF are set when the TX FIFO has space for at least four more frames.

Enum.name: ONEFRAME
Enum.description: RXFL status flag and IF are set when the RX FIFO has at least one frame in it.

Enum.name: TWOFRAMES
Enum.description: RXFL status flag and IF are set when the RX FIFO has at least two frames in it.

Enum.name: THREEFRAMES
Enum.description: RXFL status flag and IF are set when the RX FIFO has at least three frames in it.

Enum.name: FOURFRAMES
Enum.description: RXFL status flag and IF are set when the RX FIFO has four frames in it.

Enum.name: ONEFRAME
Enum.description: RTS is set if there is space for at least one more frame in the RX FIFO.

Enum.name: TWOFRAMES
Enum.description: RTS is set if there is space for at least two more frames in the RX FIFO.

Enum.name: THREEFRAMES
Enum.description: RTS is set if there is space for at least three more frames in the RX FIFO.

Enum.name: FOURFRAMES
Enum.description: RTS is set if there is space for four more frames in the RX FIFO.

Enum.name: EVEN
Enum.description: Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

Enum.name: ODD
Enum.description: Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

Enum.name: HALF
Enum.description: The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: One stop bit is generated and verified

Enum.name: ONEANDAHALF
Enum.description: The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 1/16 for OVS=0 and 1/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 2/16 for OVS=0 and 2/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: THREE
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 3/16 for OVS=0 and 3/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: FOUR
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 4/16 for OVS=0 and 4/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Filter enabled. IrDA pulse must be high for at least 4 consecutive clock cycles to be detected

Enum.name: SINGLE
Enum.description: Transmission of new frames is delayed by a single bit period.

Enum.name: DOUBLE
Enum.description: Transmission of new frames is delayed by a two bit periods.

Enum.name: TRIPPLE
Enum.description: Transmission of new frames is delayed by a three bit periods.

Register.name: FETCHADDR
Register.description: Fetcher: Start address of data block. In direct mode, this register is written by the software. In scatter-gather mode, this register is updated after each processed descriptor.

Register.name: FETCHLEN
Register.description: Fetcher: Length of data block. In direct mode, this register is written by the software. In scatter-gather mode, this register is not used.

Register.name: FETCHTAG
Register.description: Fetcher: User tag. In direct mode, this register is written by the software. In scatter-gather mode, this register is not used.

Register.name: PUSHADDR
Register.description: Pusher: Start address of data block (LSB). In direct mode, this register is written by the software. In scatter-gather mode, this register is updated after each processed descriptor.

Register.name: PUSHLEN
Register.description: Pusher: Length of data block. In direct mode, this register is written by the software. In scatter-gather mode, this register is not used.

Register.name: IF_CLR
Register.description: Writing a '1' clears the interrupt status. Writing a '0' has no effect.

BitField.name: FETCHERENDOFBLOCK
BitField.description: End of block interrupt flag clear

BitField.name: PUSHERENDOFBLOCK
BitField.description: End of block interrupt flag clear

Register.name: CTRL
Register.description: Control register, called CONFIG in Barco datasheet.

Register.name: CMD
Register.description: Command register for starting the fetcher and pusher

BitField.name: NOTEMPTY
BitField.description: Not empty flag from input FIFO (fetcher)

BitField.name: FIFODATANUM
BitField.description: Number of data in output FIFO

BitField.name: REPCOUNTIEN
BitField.description: IRQ enable for Repetition Count Test

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: The continuous test, the conditioning function and the FIFO are reset

BitField.name: PREIEN
BitField.description: IRQ enable for AIS31 prelim. noise alarm

BitField.name: ALMIEN
BitField.description: IRQ enable for AIS31 noise alarm

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Oscillators will shut down when FIFO is full

Enum.name: RUN
Enum.description: Oscillators will continue to run even after FIFO is full

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: NIST-800-90B startup test is applied. No data will be written to the FIFO until the test passes.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: AIS31 startup test is applied. No data will be written to the FIFO until the test passes.

Register.name: FIFOLEVEL
Register.description: Number of 32 bits words of random available in the FIFO. Writing to this register clears the FIFO full interrupt

Register.name: FIFOTHRESH
Register.description: FIFO level at which the rings are restarted when in the FIFOFull_Off state, expressed in number of 128bit blocks

Register.name: FIFODEPTH
Register.description: Maximum number of 32 bits words that can be stored in the FIFO: 2^g_fifodepth

Register.name: KEY0
Register.description: This set of registers bits form the 128-bit AES key used for conditioning function. The first byte (MSB of 128-bit word) is at address 0x0010, the second byte at address 0x0011...

Register.name: KEY1
Register.description: This set of registers bits form the 128-bit AES key used for conditioning function. The first byte (MSB of 128-bit word) is at address 0x0010, the second byte at address 0x0011...

Register.name: KEY2
Register.description: This set of registers bits form the 128-bit AES key used for conditioning function. The first byte (MSB of 128-bit word) is at address 0x0010, the second byte at address 0x0011...

Register.name: KEY3
Register.description: This set of registers bits form the 128-bit AES key used for conditioning function. The first byte (MSB of 128-bit word) is at address 0x0010, the second byte at address 0x0011...

Register.name: TESTDATA
Register.description: This register is used to feed known data to the conditioning function or to the continuous tests. See manual

BitField.name: VALUE
BitField.description: Test data input to conditioning tests

Enum.name: IDLE
Enum.description: TESTDATA write is finished processing or no test in progress.

Enum.name: BUSY
Enum.description: TESTDATA write is still being processed.

Register.name: SWOFFTMRVAL
Register.description: Number of clk cycles to wait before stopping the rings after the FIFO is full

Register.name: CLKDIV
Register.description: Sample clock divider. The frequency at which the outputs of the rings are sampled is given by Fs = Fpclk/(ClkDiv + 1)

Register.name: AIS31STATUS
Register.description: This register is used to obtain diagnostic information about the AIS31 start-up and online tests when g_AIS31=True. Writing to this register clears all fields

BitField.name: SIZE
BitField.description: Size of Operands in data memory

Enum.name: FALSE
Enum.description: random number under test is probably prime

Enum.name: TRUE
Enum.description: random number under test is composite

Enum.description: Do not retain associcated registers when in EM2/3

Enum.name: EM4EXIT
Enum.description: Retention through EM4: Pads enter reset state when exiting EM4

Enum.name: SWUNLATCH

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: Remove fixed capacitance on XI and XO nodes

Enum.name: XI
Enum.description: Adds fixed capacitance on XI node

Enum.name: XO
Enum.description: Adds fixed capacitance on XO node

Enum.name: BOTH
Enum.description: Adds fixed capacitance on both XI and XO nodes

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: Do not apply core degeneration resistence

Enum.name: EXTCLK
Enum.description: external sinusoidal clock can be supplied on XI pin.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Squaring buffer schmitt trigger is disabled

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Squaring buffer schmitt trigger is enabled

Register.name: CFG
Register.description: Do not write to this register unless the oscillator is forced off. The oscillator is forced off if DISONDEMAND is set and FORCEEN is cleared.

Enum.name: XTAL
Enum.description: A 32768Hz crystal should be connected to the LF crystal pads. Voltage must not exceed VDDIO.

Enum.name: BUFEXTCLK
Enum.description: An external sine source with minimum amplitude 100mv (zero-to-peak) and maximum amplitude 500mV (zero-to-peak) should be connected in series with LFXTAL_I pin. Minimum voltage should be larger than ground and maximum voltage smaller than VDDIO. The sine source does not need to be ac coupled externally as it is ac couples inside LFXO. LFXTAL_O is free to be used as a general purpose GPIO.

Enum.name: DIGEXTCLK
Enum.description: An external 32KHz CMOS clock should be provided on LFXTAL_I. LFXTAL_O is free to be used as a general purpose GPIO.

Enum.name: UNLOCKED
Enum.description: LFXO lockable registers are not locked

Register.name: CAL
Register.description: Do not write to this register unless CALBSY in SYNCBUSY register is low.

Enum.name: UNLOCKED
Enum.description: Access to configuration registers not locked

BitField.name: TCOOR

BitField.description: Temperature Check Out Of Range Enable

Register.name: LOCK

Enum.name: WS1

Enum.name: WS2
Enum.description: Two wait-states inserted for eatch fetch or read transfer

Enum.name: WS3
Enum.description: Three wait-states inserted for eatch fetch or read transfer

BitField.description: Invalid Write Address or Erase Page

BitField.name: PWRUPF
BitField.description: Flash Power Up Sequence Complete Flag

BitField.name: PWROFF
BitField.description: Flash Power Off Sequence Complete Flag

BitField.name: WDATAOV

BitField.name: PWRUPF
BitField.description: Flash Power Up Seq done irq enable

BitField.name: PWROFF
BitField.description: Flash Power Off Seq done irq enable

Enum.name: LOCK
Enum.description: Key to lock the register lock

Enum.name: UNLOCK
Enum.description: Key to unlock the register lock.

BitField.name: PWROFFONEM1ENTRY
BitField.description: Power down Flash macro when enter EM1

BitField.name: PWROFFENTRYAGAIN
BitField.description: POWER down flash again in EM1/EM1p

Register.name: IPVERSION
Register.description: The read only IPVERSION field gives the version for this module. There may be minor software changes required for modules with different values of IPVERSION.

Enum.name: ADVANCED
Enum.description: Advanced buffering mode, where the cache uses the fetch pattern to predict highly accessed data and store it in low-energy memory

Enum.name: MINACTIVITY
Enum.description: Minimum activity mode, which allows the cache to minimize activity in logic that it predicts has a low probability being used. This mode can introduce wait-states into the instruction fetch stream when the cache exits one of its low-activity states. The number of wait-states introduced is small, but users running with 0-wait-state memory and wishing to reduce the variability that the cache might introduce with additional wait-states may wish to lower the cache low-power level. Note, this mode includes the advanced buffering mode functionality.

Enum.name: WRITE
Enum.description: Write immediate value structure type selected.

Enum.name: ALL
Enum.description: Transfer all units as specified by the XFRCNT field

BitField.name: DONEIEN
BitField.description: DMA Operation Done Interrupt Flag Set En

Enum.name: BLOCK
Enum.description: The LDMA transfers one BLOCKSIZE per transfer request.

Enum.name: ALL
Enum.description: One transfer request transfers all units as defined by the XFRCNT field.

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: Increment source address by one unit data size after each read

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: Increment source address by two unit data sizes after each read

Enum.name: FOUR
Enum.description: Increment source address by four unit data sizes after each read

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: Do not increment the source address. In this mode reads are made from a fixed source address, for example reading FIFO.

Enum.name: BYTE
Enum.description: Each unit transfer is a byte

Enum.name: HALFWORD
Enum.description: Each unit transfer is a half-word

Enum.name: WORD
Enum.description: Each unit transfer is a word

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: Increment destination address by one unit data size after each write

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: Increment destination address by two unit data sizes after each write

Enum.name: FOUR
Enum.description: Increment destination address by four unit data sizes after each write

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: Do not increment the destination address. Writes are made to a fixed destination address, for example writing to a FIFO.

Enum.name: ABSOLUTE
Enum.description: The SRCADDR field of LDMA_CHx_SRC contains the absolute address of the source data.

Enum.name: RELATIVE
Enum.description: The SRCADDR field of LDMA_CHx_SRC contains the relative offset of the source data.

Enum.description: The DSTADDR field of LDMA_CHx_DST contains the absolute address of the destination data.

Enum.description: The DSTADDR field of LDMA_CHx_DST contains the relative offset of the destination data.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Timer operation is unaffected by other timers.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Timer may be started, stopped and re-loaded from other timer instances.

Enum.name: HALT
Enum.description: Timer is halted in debug mode

Enum.name: RUN
Enum.description: Timer is running in debug mode

Enum.name: TIMEROUF
Enum.description: Timer is clocked by underflow(down-count) or overflow(up-count) in the lower numbered neighbor Timer

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: Timer can start/stop/reload other timers with SYNC bit set

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: Timer cannot start/stop/reload other timers with SYNC bit set

Enum.name: PULSE
Enum.description: Each CC event will generate a one EM01GRPACLK cycle high pulse

Enum.name: LEVEL
Enum.description: The PRS channel will follow CC out

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: No edge detection, signal is left as it is

Enum.name: EVERYEDGE
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on every capture

Enum.name: EVERYSECONDEDGE
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on every second capture

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on rising edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

Enum.name: FALLING
Enum.description: PRS output pulse and interrupt flag set on falling edge only (if ICEDGE = BOTH)

BitField.name: DTFATS
BitField.description: DTI Fault Action on Timer Stop

Enum.name: UNLOCK
Enum.description: Write to unlock TIMER DTI registers

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The USART operates in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The USART operates in synchronous mode

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The receiver is connected to and receives data from U(S)n_RX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The receiver is connected to and receives data from U(S)n_TX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Collision check is enabled. The receiver must be enabled for the check to be performed

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The 9th bit of incoming frames has no special function

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: An incoming frame with the 9th bit equal to MPAB will be loaded into the receive buffer regardless of RXBLOCK and will result in the MPAB interrupt flag being set

Enum.name: X16
Enum.description: Regular UART mode with 16X oversampling in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: X8
Enum.description: Double speed with 8X oversampling in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: X4
Enum.description: Quadruple speed with 4X oversampling in asynchronous mode

Enum.name: IDLELOW
Enum.description: The bus clock used in synchronous mode has a low base value

Enum.name: IDLEHIGH
Enum.description: The bus clock used in synchronous mode has a high base value

Enum.name: SAMPLELEADING
Enum.description: Data is sampled on the leading edge and set-up on the trailing edge of the bus clock in synchronous mode

Enum.name: SAMPLETRAILING
Enum.description: Data is set-up on the leading edge and sampled on the trailing edge of the bus clock in synchronous mode

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Data is sent with the least significant bit first

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Data is sent with the most significant bit first

BitField.name: CSMA
BitField.description: Action On Slave-Select In Master Mode

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: TXBL and the TXBL interrupt flag are set when the transmit buffer becomes empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes nonempty.

Enum.name: HALFFULL
Enum.description: TXBL and TXBLIF are set when the transmit buffer goes from full to half-full or empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes full.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Input is passed directly to the receiver

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Input is inverted before it is passed to the receiver

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Output from the transmitter is passed unchanged to U(S)n_TX

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Output from the transmitter is inverted before it is passed to U(S)n_TX

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The output on U(S)n_TX when the transmitter is idle is defined by TXINV

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: U(S)n_TX is tristated whenever the transmitter is idle

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors have no effect on DMA requests from the USART

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: DMA requests from the USART are blocked while the PERR or FERR interrupt flags are set

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors have no effect on receiver

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Framing and parity errors disable the receiver

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Received framing and parity errors have no effect on transmitter

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Received framing and parity errors disable the transmitter

BitField.name: AUTOTX
BitField.description: Always Transmit When RX Not Full

Enum.name: EVEN
Enum.description: Even parity are used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

Enum.name: ODD
Enum.description: Odd parity is used. Parity bits are automatically generated and checked by hardware.

Enum.name: HALF
Enum.description: The transmitter generates a half stop bit. Stop-bits are not verified by receiver

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: One stop bit is generated and verified

Enum.name: ONEANDAHALF
Enum.description: The transmitter generates one and a half stop bit. The receiver verifies the first stop bit

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: The transmitter generates two stop bits. The receiver checks the first stop-bit only

BitField.name: TXARX0EN
BitField.description: Enable Transmit Trigger after RX End of

BitField.name: TXARX1EN
BitField.description: Enable Transmit Trigger after RX End of

BitField.name: TXARX2EN
BitField.description: Enable Transmit Trigger after RX End of

BitField.name: RXATX0EN
BitField.description: Enable Receive Trigger after TX end of f

BitField.name: RXATX1EN
BitField.description: Enable Receive Trigger after TX end of f

BitField.name: RXATX2EN
BitField.description: Enable Receive Trigger after TX end of f

BitField.name: TXBDRIGHT
BitField.description: TX Buffer Expects Double Right Data

BitField.name: TXBSRIGHT
BitField.description: TX Buffer Expects Single Right Data

BitField.name: SSM
BitField.description: Slave-Select In Master Mode Interrupt Fl

BitField.name: SSM
BitField.description: Slave-Select In Master Mode Interrupt Fl

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 1/16 for OVS=0 and 1/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 2/16 for OVS=0 and 2/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: THREE
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 3/16 for OVS=0 and 3/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: FOUR
Enum.description: IrDA pulse width is 4/16 for OVS=0 and 4/8 for OVS=1

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Filter enabled. IrDA pulse must be high for at least 5 consecutive clock cycles to be detected

BitField.name: DMASPLIT
BitField.description: Separate DMA Request For Left/Right Data

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Disable - TXDELAY in USARTn_CTRL can be used for legacy

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: Start of transmission is delayed for 1 baud-times

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: Start of transmission is delayed for 2 baud-times

Enum.name: THREE
Enum.description: Start of transmission is delayed for 3 baud-times

Enum.name: SEVEN
Enum.description: Start of transmission is delayed for 7 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP0
Enum.description: Start of transmission is delayed for TCMPVAL0 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP1
Enum.description: Start of transmission is delayed for TCMPVAL1 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP2
Enum.description: Start of transmission is delayed for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

Enum.name: ZERO
Enum.description: CS is not asserted before start of transmission

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 1 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 2 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: THREE
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 3 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: SEVEN
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 7 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: TCMP0
Enum.description: CS is asserted before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL0 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP1
Enum.description: CS is asserted before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL1 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP2
Enum.description: CS is asserted before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

Enum.name: ZERO
Enum.description: There is no space between charcters

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: Create a space of 1 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: Create a space of 2 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: THREE
Enum.description: Create a space of 3 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: SEVEN
Enum.description: Create a space of 7 baud-times before start of transmission

Enum.name: TCMP0
Enum.description: Create a space of before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL0 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP1
Enum.description: Create a space of before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL1 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP2
Enum.description: Create a space of before the start of transmission for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

Enum.name: ZERO
Enum.description: Disable CS being asserted after the end of transmission

Enum.name: ONE
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 1 baud-times after the end of transmission

Enum.name: TWO
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 2 baud-times after the end of transmission

Enum.name: THREE
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 3 baud-times after the end of transmission

Enum.name: SEVEN
Enum.description: CS is asserted for 7 baud-times after the end of transmission

Enum.name: TCMP0
Enum.description: CS is asserted after the end of transmission for TCMPVAL0 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP1
Enum.description: CS is asserted after the end of transmission for TCMPVAL1 baud-times

Enum.name: TCMP2
Enum.description: CS is asserted after the end of transmission for TCMPVAL2 baud-times

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Continue to transmit until TX buffer is empty

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Negate RTS to stop link partner's transmission during debug HALT. NOTE** The core clock should be equal to or faster than the peripheral clock; otherwise, each single step could transmit multiple frames instead of just transmitting one frame.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The USn_CTS pin is low true

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The USn_CTS pin is high true

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Stop transmitting when CTS is negated

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The USn_RTS pin is low true

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The USn_RTS pin is high true

Enum.name: TXEOF

Enum.name: TXC
Enum.description: Comparator 0 and timer are started at TX Complete

Enum.name: RXACT

Enum.name: RXEOF
Enum.description: Comparator 0 and timer are started at RX end of frame

Enum.name: RXACT

Enum.description: Comparator 0 is disabled on RX going Inactive

Enum.name: ENABLE

Enum.description: Comparator 1 is disabled at TX start TX Engine

Enum.name: RXACT
Enum.description: Comparator 1 is disabled on RX going going Active (default: low)

Enum.name: RXACTN
Enum.description: Comparator 1 is disabled on RX going Inactive

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Disable the timer restarting on TCMP1

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: All addresses will be responded to with a NACK

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Addresses matching the programmed slave address or the general call address (if enabled) require a response from software. Other addresses are automatically responded to with a NACK.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Software must give one ACK command for each ACK transmitted on the I2C bus.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Addresses that are not automatically NACK'ed, and all data is automatically acknowledged.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: A stop must be sent manually when no more data is to be transmitted.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The master automatically sends a STOP when no more data is available for transmission.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Stop is not automatically sent if a NACK is received from a slave.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The master automatically sends a STOP if a NACK is received from a slave.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: When a device loses arbitration, the ARBIF interrupt flag is set and the bus is released.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: When a device loses arbitration, the ARBIF interrupt flag is set, but communication proceeds.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: General call address will be NACK'ed if it is not included by the slave address and address mask.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: When a general call address is received, a software response is required

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: TXBL status and the TXBL interrupt flag are set when the transmit buffer becomes empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes nonempty.

Enum.name: HALF_FULL
Enum.description: TXBL status and the TXBL interrupt flag are set when the transmit buffer goes from full to half-full or empty. TXBL is cleared when the buffer becomes full

Enum.name: FAST
Enum.description: Nlow=11 and Nhigh=6, and the Nlow:Nhigh ratio is 11:6

Enum.name: WUDVL
Enum.description: When using suspend mode, conversions performed in EM2 or EM3 should not wake up the DMA until the FIFO's DVL setting is reached. This saves more power for large OSR settings or infrequent sampling.

Enum.name: WUCONVERT
Enum.description: When using suspend mode, conversions performed in EM2 or EM3 will wake up the DMA and keep it awake until the conversions are done, regardless of the DVL setting. This mode burns more power, but it is useful when the conversion rate is faster than the time for the DMA to cycle through wake up and going back to sleep as it converts more than 4 scan table entries. Without using the wake up on conversion mode, the FIFO may overflow while the DMA is going in and out of sleep.

Enum.name: PRSWUDIS
Enum.description: Normal mode which does not disable the ADC_CLK.

Enum.name: PRSWUEN
Enum.description: ADCCLKWUEN will gate off ADC_CLK until the trigger is detected provided the internal timer is not selected as the trigger. Once the trigger is detected the ADC_CLK will be started, the band gap will be started, the ADC will be warmed up, and the SCAN Table and the Single entry will be converted. Once the conversions are done, the ADC_CLK will be gated off.

Enum.name: PRSWUDIS
Enum.description: Normal mode which does not disable the ADC_CLK.

Enum.name: PRSWUEN
Enum.description: ADCCLKWUEN will gate off ADC_CLK until the trigger is detected provided the internal timer is not selected as the trigger. Once the trigger is detected the ADC_CLK will be started, the band gap will be started, the ADC will be warmed up, and the SCAN Table and the Single entry will be converted. Once the conversions are done, the ADC_CLK will be gated off.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Continue operation as normal during debug mode

Enum.name: HALT
Enum.description: Complete the current conversion and then halt during debug mode

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Shut down the IADC after conversions have completed.

Enum.name: KEEPINSTANDBY
Enum.description: Switch to standby mode after conversions have completed. The next warmup time will require 1us.

Enum.name: KEEPWARM
Enum.description: Keep IADC fully powered after conversions have completed.

Enum.name: DIV1
Enum.description: Use CMU_CLK_ADC directly. The source clock must be 40 MHz or less.

Enum.name: DIV2
Enum.description: Divide CMU_CLK_ADC by 2 before using it. The resulting CLK_SRC_ADC must be 40 MHz or less.

Enum.name: DIV3
Enum.description: Divide CMU_CLK_ADC by 3 before using it. The resulting CLK_SRC_ADC must be 40 MHz or less.

Enum.name: DIV4
Enum.description: Divide CMU_CLK_ADC by 4 before using it. The resulting CLK_SRC_ADC must be 40 MHz or less.

BitField.name: ADLT
BitField.description: ADC Less Than or Equal to Threshold

BitField.name: ADGT
BitField.description: ADC Greater Than or Equal to Threshold

BitField.name: SINGLEFIFODVL
BitField.description: Single FIFO Data Valid Level Enable

BitField.name: SCANFIFODVL
BitField.description: Scan FIFO Data Valid Level Enable

Enum.name: IMMEDIATE
Enum.description: Immediate triggering. The scan queue will be disabled once all conversions in the scan table are complete, unless TRIGGERACTION is set to continuous.

Enum.name: TIMER
Enum.description: Triggers when the local timer count reaches zero.

Enum.name: PRSCLKGRP
Enum.description: Triggers on PRS0 from a timer module that is using the same clock group as the ADC and has been programmed to use the same clock source as the ADC. The prescale may be different between the ADC and the timer module.

Enum.name: PRSPOS
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS0 positive edge. Requires PRS0 to go low for 3 ADC_CLKs before another positive edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization.

Enum.name: PRSNEG
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS0 negative edge. Requires PRS0 to go high for 3 ADC_CLKs before another negative edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization. PRSNEG should only be used when the trigger source is from a module that remains powered during EM23. For modules (ie: TIMER) that power down during EM23, PRSPOS should be used for an asynchronous trigger, and PRSCLKGRP should be used for a synchronous trigger.

Enum.name: ONCE
Enum.description: For TRIGSEL=IMMEDIATE, goes through the scan table once and disables queue. For TRIGSEL = TIMER, PRSCLKGRP, PRSPOS, PRSNEG, goes through the scan table once per trigger.

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Goes through the scan table, converts each entry with a mask bit set, and puts it back into the scan queue to repeat again continuously. The queues are first come first serve. If both queues are triggered, the single queue will get to convert after each scan table completes. The scan queue will get to convert after each single conversion completes.

Enum.name: IMMEDIATE
Enum.description: Immediate triggering. The single queue will be disabled once the conversion is complete, unless TRIGGERACTION is set to continuous.

Enum.name: TIMER
Enum.description: Triggers when the local timer count reaches zero.

Enum.name: PRSCLKGRP
Enum.description: Triggers on PRS1 from a timer module that is using the same clock group as the ADC and has been programmed to use the same clock source as the ADC. The prescale may be different between the ADC and the timer module.

Enum.name: PRSPOS
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS1 positive edge. Requires PRS1 to go low for 3 ADC_CLKs before another positive edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization.

Enum.name: PRSNEG
Enum.description: Triggers on asynchronous PRS1 negative edge. Requires PRS1 to go high for 3 ADC_CLKs before another negative edge can be detected. Generates an additional delay of 1 to 2 ADC_SRC_CLK cycles for synchronization. PRSNEG should only be used when the trigger source is from a module that remains powered during EM23. For modules (ie: TIMER) that power down during EM23, PRSPOS should be used for an asynchronous trigger, and PRSCLKGRP should be used for a synchronous trigger.

Enum.name: ONCE
Enum.description: For TRIGSEL=IMMEDIATE, converts the single queue once and disables queue. For TRIGSEL = TIMER, PRSCLKGRP, PRSPOS, PRSNEG, converts the single queue once per trigger.ask.

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Converts the single queue, then checks for a pending scan queue before converting the single queue again continuously. The queues are first come first serve. If both queues are continuous, the IADC alternates between them.

Enum.name: TAILGATEOFF
Enum.description: The single queue is ready to start warming up and converting once the trigger had been detected.

Enum.name: TAILGATEON
Enum.description: After the single queue's trigger is detected, it must wait until the end of a scan operation before the Single queue can be converted.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: High speed mode with a maximum CLK_ADC of 10 MHz.

Enum.name: AVG1
Enum.description: Collect one output word (no digital averaging).

Enum.name: AVG2
Enum.description: Collect and average 2 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG4
Enum.description: Collect and average 4 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG8
Enum.description: Collect and average 8 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG16
Enum.description: Collect and average 16 digital output words.

Enum.name: AUTO
Enum.description: Automatic: Single ended measurements are reported as unipolar and differential measurements are reported as bipolar.

Enum.name: FORCEUNIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in unipolar output. Negative differential numbers will saturate to 0.

Enum.name: FORCEBIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in bipolar output. Single ended measurements are half the range, but allow for small negative measurements.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: High speed mode with a maximum CLK_ADC of 10 MHz.

Enum.name: AVG1
Enum.description: Collect one output word (no digital averaging).

Enum.name: AVG2
Enum.description: Collect and average 2 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG4
Enum.description: Collect and average 4 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG8
Enum.description: Collect and average 8 digital output words.

Enum.name: AVG16
Enum.description: Collect and average 16 digital output words.

Enum.name: AUTO
Enum.description: Automatic: Single ended measurements are reported as unipolar and differential measurements are reported as bipolar.

Enum.name: FORCEUNIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in unipolar output. Negative differential numbers will saturate to 0.

Enum.name: FORCEBIPOLAR
Enum.description: Force all measurements to result in bipolar output. Single ended measurements are half the range, but allow for small negative measurements.

Enum.name: VALID1
Enum.description: When 1 entry in the single FIFO is valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID2
Enum.description: When 2 entries in the single FIFO are valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID3
Enum.description: When 3 entries in the single FIFO are valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID4
Enum.description: When 4 entries in the single FIFO are valid, set the SINGLEFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will not be requested.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will be requested when the single FIFO reaches its Data Valid Level. [DVL must be set to 0 (VALID1).]

Register.name: SINGLEFIFODATA
Register.description: Read the oldest valid data from the single FIFO and pop the FIFO

Enum.name: VALID1
Enum.description: When 1 entry in the scan FIFO is valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID2
Enum.description: When 2 entries in the scan FIFO are valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID3
Enum.description: When 3 entries in the scan FIFO are valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: VALID4
Enum.description: When 4 entries in the scan FIFO are valid, set the SCANFIFODVL interrupt and request DMA.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will not be requested.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: While in EM2 or EM3, the DMA controller will be requested when the scan FIFO reaches its Data Valid Level. [DVL must be set to 0 (VALID1).]

Register.name: SCANFIFODATA
Register.description: Read the oldest valid data from the scan FIFO and pop the FIFO

Register.name: SCANDATA
Register.description: Most recent data data from scan queue conversion
